memberdef.argsstring: (Vector< IndexType > const &a_index_type, IntVect const &a_nghost, Geometry const &a_geom, BoxArray const &a_grids, DistributionMapping const &a_dmap, Marker &&a_marker, Filler &&a_filler, int a_verbose=0, std::string a_options_namespace="hypre")
memberdef.name: HypreSolver

parameterdescription.para: functor that returns whether the variable n at (i,j,k) in Box boxno (local index) is valid (i.e., not exactly on Dirichlet boundary). function signature: (intboxno,inti,intj,intk,intn)->bool
namespace to use when parsing runtime input parameters (default literal "hypre" used for HYPRE options)

param.type: std::enable_if_t< IsFabArray< MF >::value &&std::is_same_v< typename MF::value_type, HYPRE_Real >, int >

memberdef.name: solve

briefdescription.para: Solve Ax=b after the constructor assembled the IJ matrix.
Number of iterations from the last solve().
Final residual norm from the last solve().
Access the assembled IJ matrix handle (non-owning).
Access the assembled IJ RHS handle (non-owning).

memberdef.type: std::enable_if_t< IsCallable< Marker, int, int, int, int, int >::value >

memberdef.name: fill_local_id

briefdescription.para: Assign local ids to each owned DOF by invoking marker.
Convert the local ids to globally unique ids visible to HYPRE.

briefdescription.para: Fill each CSR row using the supplied filler functor.

parameterdescription.para: Functor with signature (int boxno, int i, int j, int k, int n, Array4<HYPRE_Int const> const* gid, HYPRE_Int& ncols, HYPRE_Int* cols, HYPRE_Real* mat) that emits the nonzeros for each DOF.

memberdef.name: load_vectors

briefdescription.para: Copy AMReX RHS/initial guess data into the IJ vectors.

param.type: std::enable_if_t< IsFabArray< MF >::value &&std::is_same_v< typename MF::value_type, HYPRE_Real >, int >

briefdescription.para: Copy IJ solution entries back into AMReX storage.
Solve Ax = b using HYPRE's generic IJ matrix format where A is a sparse matrix specified using the compressed sparse row (CSR) format.

detaileddescription.para: An example of using HypreSolver to solve Poisson's equation is located in Tests/LinearSolvers/Hypre (which exercises the HYPRE backend)
